message:
feat: Implement live audio streaming with real-time analysis and visualization

- Add Analyser class for FFT analysis of audio input, producing 16 bins.
- Create AudioIO class for handling microphone input and speaker output, including PCM conversion.
- Develop GeminiLiveClient for WebSocket communication with Gemini Live API, sending and receiving audio data.
- Build LiveAudioPage to manage audio streaming, permissions, and UI state.
- Integrate SphereScene for 3D visualization of audio data, reacting to input and output energy.
- Ensure proper resource management with initialization and disposal of audio components.

- Integrated assets for PDF and DOC file types.

feat(ios): Migrate from CocoaPods to Swift Package Manager

Major Changes:
- Remove CocoaPods dependency management (Podfile, Podfile.lock)
- Integrate Swift Package Manager for iOS plugin dependencies
- Add FlutterGeneratedPluginSwiftPackage to Xcode project
- Configure 'Run Prepare Flutter Framework Script' pre-action in build scheme

iOS Changes:
- Updated project.pbxproj with SPM package references
- Modified Runner.xcscheme to include SPM pre-action script
- Updated Flutter configuration files (Debug.xcconfig, Release.xcconfig)
- Regenerated app icons with Flutter standard naming (Icon-App-*)
- Updated workspace configuration for SPM compatibility

Android Changes:
- Migrated build scripts to Kotlin DSL (.gradle.kts)
- Updated MainActivity to Kotlin package structure
- Modernized Android build configuration

Dependencies:
- Updated pubspec.lock with latest package versions
- All Flutter plugins now resolved via SPM for iOS

This migration enables:
- Native Swift Package Manager support for iOS dependencies
- Faster dependency resolution and builds
- Better Xcode integration
- Elimination of CocoaPods overhead

Refs: Flutter SPM documentation
https://docs.flutter.dev/packages-and-plugins/swift-package-manager/for-app-developers

Keep AuthBloc dedicated to Send OTP

Refactor authentication architecture to implement feature-based CRUD separation.
- Separate OTP verification logic from authentication feature into dedicated authentication-verify feature
- Remove verifyOtp operations from authentication feature (repository, datasource, usecase, bloc)
- Create complete authentication-verify feature with clean architecture layers:
  * Domain: entities, repositories, usecases (verify OTP, resend OTP)
  * Data: models, datasources, repository implementations with proper error handling
  * Presentation: dedicated VerifyBloc with comprehensive state management
- Update authentication-verify page to use new VerifyBloc instead of AuthBloc
- Update service locator (dependency injection) to register new authentication-verify dependencies
- Remove verify_otp_usecase.dart from authentication feature
- Update AuthBloc constructor to remove verifyOtpUseCase parameter
- Implement proper separation of concerns following feature-based CRUD approach
- Each feature now handles its own specific operations:
  * Authentication feature: Send OTP operations only
  * Authentication-verify feature: Verify OTP and resend OTP operations only
- Add comprehensive error handling with NetworkFailure and ServerFailure types
- Maintain clean architecture principles across both features
- Update imports and dependencies to reflect new architecture
